comment.author: 46696233@N00
comment._content: Charles 'The Little Apache" Ledoux (but he was French. Those were weird times) www.boxrec.com/list_bouts.php?human_id=17961&cat=boxer won 99 (KO 81) + lost 29 (KO 3) + drawn 6

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks!  We'll add the information to the source data and reload the description.

comment.author: 32853590@N00
comment._content: Ledoux is demonstrating a technique from savate (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Savate), specifically a coup de pied bas. It seems as if he is doing it from a false guard, similar to instructions for this technique given in “La Defense Dans La Rue” by Joseph J Renuad, published in 1912 (defensedanslarue.wordpress.com/skills/the-street-kicks-of...). As for his name Little Apache, I think you might find an explanation here (defensedanslarue.wordpress.com/history/the-dirty-tricks-o...) or here (jmanly.ejmas.com/articles/2005/jmanlyart_apaches_0105.htm)
